awd_titl_txt: Continuous Crustal Deformation Measurement:  Data Analysis  and Instrument Development
awd_abstract_narration: This award studies of active crustal deformation in southern               California, in research areas that should complement past and                   future geodetic studies.  Previous work has emphasized analysis                 of data from with instruments Pinon Flat Observatory (PFO), along               with the development of the techniques needed for high-quality                  measurements.  The PIs will continue this, focusing on ways to                  use existing deformation data, both from PFO and from geodetic                  surveys, to test hypotheses about the nature of fault zones.                    They will continue a detailed examination of the USGS EDM-network               data in southern California, working on the difficult inverse                   problem of solving for fault-plane displacements given the                      observed line-length changes.  This investigation should improve                not only understanding of fault mechanics, but should also prove                valuable for planning future geodetic measurements near active                  faults.  This award falls under NEHRP.

inst.inst_name: University of California-San Diego Scripps Inst of Oceanography
